H0.text: all of the states in the northeast region. New Hampshire

H1.text: all of the states in the northeast region. Massachusetts

H2.text: all of the states in the northeast region. Rhode Island

H3.text: all of the states in the northeast region. Maine

A4.text: The Census Bureau defines the region as including the six New England states of Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and Vermont, and three lower North-Eastern states of New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.

A5.text: New England is a region consisting of six states in the Northeastern United States: Connecticut, Maine, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, and Vermont.

A6.text: New England is defined as the six states of Maine, Vermont, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut.

A7.text: Traditional definitions include seven U.S. states: New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Delaware, Maryland, Virginia, West Virginia, and the national capital of Washington, D.C.
